title: Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer
summary: The Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (WISE, observatory code C51) is a NASA infrared astronomy space telescope. It was launched in December 2009,[3][4][5] and placed in hibernation mode in February 2011,[6] before being re-activated in 2013 and renamed the Near-Earth Object Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (NEOWISE).[7]  WISE discovered thousands of minor planets and numerous star clusters.  Its observations also supported the discovery of the first Y Dwarf and Earth trojan asteroid.[6][8][9][10][11][12]
